Authors: Kusuma G.P., Harjono K.D., Dwi Putra M.T.
Title: Geometric verification method of best score increasing subsequence for object instance recognition
Source title: 2019 6th International Conference on Information Technology, Computer and Electrical Engineering, ICITACEE 2019
Affiliations: Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program, Master of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Kusuma, G.P., Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program, Master of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Harjono, K.D., Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program, Master of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia; Dwi Putra, M.T., Bina Nusantara University, BINUS Graduate Program, Master of Computer Science, Computer Science Department, Jakarta, 11480, Indonesia
Abstract: Weighted Longest Increasing Subsequence (WLIS) and its improvement, Best Increasing Subsequence (BIS) are two methods that has been proposed for pair verification in object instance recognition using local features. Tested on the Stanford Mobile Visual Dataset (SMVS), the BIS achieves better performance than WLIS on most categories, except for the 'video frames' category. In this paper we propose several modifications to BIS which resulted in a better overall performance compared to the WLIS and the basic BIS approaches. On average, the proposed Best Score Increasing Subsequence (BSIS) performs 4.53% better than the BIS and 9.43% better than the WLIS. © 2019 IEEE.
Author Keywords: Best increasing subsequence; Geometric verification; Instance recognition; Object recognition; Smvs dataset
Index Keywords: Computer science; Computers; Electrical engineering; Mathematical techniques; Best increasing subsequence; Geometric verifications; Instance recognition; Local feature; Longest increasing subsequences; Smvs dataset; Stanford; Video frame; Object recognition
